description.narrative: The project will achieve this objective via four components: 1) policy development and implementation; 2) market development; 3) education and outreach; and 4) demonstration projects embodying best practices and technology.
independent political entity
Increased accessibility and market share of EE lighting
Market share of incandescent lamps CFLs and other types of conventional and efficient lighting

comment.narrative:
Incandescent lighting accounts for 77 percent of all lighting in buildings Lamps up to 100W permitted as of July 2012
Lightemitting diodes LEDs account for 3 percent of the market for light sources in Kazakhstan

Incandescent lighting is no longer sold for conventional applications in Kazakhstan
LEDs are available for indoor and outdoor applications nationwide and account for 6 percent total national market share for lighting

Incandescent lamps cover 32 of all the lighting in buildings
LEDs account for 28 percent of the market for light sources
There were analyzed production quantities of lamps by types and lighting units within the period 2012 2014
Lighting market research by usage of lamps and lighting fixtures established pool in major scopes of application
Analysis of foreigneconomic activity by quantities of importexport of lighting technologies quantities in number and price aspects with characteristics of products and its basic prices for the period of 20122014
Evaluation of the capacity of Kazakhstan lamps market for the period of 2012 2014

description.narrative: Increased familiarity among diverse stakeholders with EE lighting and associated issues

Awareness of general public about advantages of EE lighting rating and labeling systems for lighting and proper handling of spent mercurycontaining lamps as measured by quantitative scoring of survey data
Coverage of outreach campaigns in terms of population

comment.narrative: Not defined quantitatively General public widely disregards advantages of EE lighting Ratinglabeling systems and mercurylamp collection programs for general public do not exist

Outreach campaigns conducted reaching 65 million citizens
Forty percent of overall population is aware of advantages of EE lighting rating and labelling systems for lighting and proper handling of spent mercurycontaining lamps

The project has totally 5 videos 2013 2 videos made one video promotes mercury utilization and another video shows advantages of energy efficient lighting These videos were actively promoted in 2014 The utilization video was rotated in the cinemas of Kinopark label afterwards Astana municipality helped to show this video on TV Currently the video is shown in Astana public places such as railway stations buses center for people services etc The video is posted on youtube also it is shown during project events In the period of 20132014 when it was actively promoted it covered about 600 thouspeople In 20142015 it covered about 200 thous people Up to date it totally covered 800 thouspeople
The extended video about various advantages of energy efficient lighting was submitted to the MINT now Ministry for investment and development which helped to have it shown on state channels Currently it is promoted during project events 20131014 the video covered 600 thouspeople 20142015 100 thouspeople totally 700 thouspeople covered
Two videos made 3D video and a cartoon The cartoon shows the lighting evolution and the 3D video talks about energy saving and EE lighting The videos are promoted on the internet Also there were made EE lighting awareness installations which then were distributed among project partners The Project Facebook page is regularly updated and has a growing number of followers and viewers The Project always participated in contests related to energy saving ideas promotion Totally printed materials distribution covered about 10 thouspeople
20122013 1 thous people 20132014 7 thous people 20142015 2 thouspeople
In 2014 there were made PR events in various cities of Kazakhstan in the form of installing informational stands in city squares during those events people were informed about EE lighting and were given project printed materials The events took place in Astana Almaty Atyrau and Aktau in AugustSeptember 2014
Six pressbriefings were given in Astana Atyrau Aktau and Semey in the period of JuneNovember 2014
The project regularly conducts mediatrainings for journalists regarding use of multimedia tools when discussing issues of energy efficiency In 2014 mediatrainings were made in UstKamenogorsk Kyzylorda and Aktau In 2015 in Eastern and Southern Kazakhstan two mediatrainings were carried out In 2015 mediatrainings were given in Kyzyorda Shymkent and Aktau
TV shows In 2015 in three regions of the country Aktau Shymkent Kyzylorda the project experts participated in the TV talkshows to discuss energy saving and energy efficiency
Totally seminars mediatrainings and TV shows covered about 400 thouspeople 20132014 250 thouspeople 20142015 150 thouspeople
Trainings were given to trainers of energy auditors according to study module for energy audit of lighting systems in buildings structures and street lighting The project participated in the training seminars for energy managers in Energy Efficiency Centers about 500 people covered 20132014 350 people 20142015 150 people

description.narrative: Increased investor confidence design and administrative capacity and market share of EE lighting as a result of demonstration projects
Replication of demonstration project results in terms of number of projects number of regions and amount of financing mobilized

comment.narrative: Businessasusual does not reflect practices that are to be applied in demonstration projects

Replication of demonstration project results in at least five projects in five regions
At least 12 million invested in EE lighting projects

Funds were assigned from the local budget in
EasternKazakhstan oblast 420 modern LED lighting fixtures were installed in UstKamenogorsk for the roadway lighting In 2014 all over EasternKazakhstan oblast 13 884 energy saving lighting fixtures were installed for the amount of 41 mln dollars
In Pavlodar oblast among 30 250 street lighting fixtures more than 11 thousand or 35 were changed to energy saving types for the amount of 33 mln dollars Also 28 sets of automated street lighting were installed for the total amount of 23 000 dollars
In NorthernKazakhstan oblast there was installed and set the automated system for street lighting control through the GSM network covering 40 of the capacity 400Wt mercury lighting fixtures were completely replaced with the 250 Wt energy saving types The economic saving for a year was 20 000 dollars In oblast 55 of all the street and park lighting was replaced with the energy saving lamps

description.narrative: Energy savings and GHG emissions reductions from EE upgrades of lighting in selected public buildings or streetlighting projects

comment.narrative: Outdated lighting technology is widely used in both buildings and street lighting Quantitative baseline parameters to be determined during design phase for each specific project

31000 tons of direct avoided CO2 emissions over operating lifetime of deployed demonstration technology
Specific technical and economic performance targets to be determined for each project

Project had modernized street lighting systems in 5 pilot areas within Kazakhstan Northern Eastern Western and Central regions Energy efficient LED lighting equipment with automatic control was installed Power saving is 5 961 MWth which shall prevent from 5550 CO2 emission from fuel combustion used for power generation
Together with the Project and the new Joint Program of the UN and Mangistau and Kyzylorda oblasts the lighting was modernized in schools Demonstration projects include lighting modernization of the 41 classrooms in 4 schools of Kyzylorda and Mangistau
Powert saving is 2 976 MWth which shall prevent from 2 775 СО2 emission from fuel combustion used for power generation
Total GHG emissions reduction amounted to 10 850 tons СО2

description.narrative: Policy development and implementation supports effective IL phaseout expansion of market share and use of EE lighting and safe disposition of spent Hgcontaining spent lamps
Code requirements for energy performance of lighting in buildings

comment.narrative: Minimum 55 lumens per watt for limited applications
Additional revision of SNRK 204052002 and others for greater energy efficiency including recommendatory sections

55 lumen minimum per 1 Watt for limited light sources There were worked out recommendations for the Committee of construction and housing services of the Ministry for Regional Development of the RK and other relevant organizations according to new requirements andor reference sections in lighting norms andor other normative documents

description.narrative: State policy and program on mercury Hg containment and recovery

comment.narrative: National mandate for Hg containment and recovery developed by RK Ministry of Environmental Protection and sent to regional governments No regional programs yet implemented in response No organized collection of spent lamps among general public
Processes for collection of mercury wastes operating nationwide At least three regional programs for collection of mercury wastes with documented 50 percent recovery of mercury from spent lamps

The number of the collected and utilized lamps is 657 mln lamps 247 mln for the reported period
In Astana the utilization of mercury lamps from local population continues 12 mln lamps have been collected
Since March 2015 the Program for mercury lamps utilization started in Mangistau oblast

description.narrative: Requirements of technical standards for EE lighting

comment.narrative: No technical standards for EE lighting
Technical standards developed adopted and enforced for EE lighting
7 technical standards for EE lighting were developed and approved

description.narrative: Implementation of incandescentlighting phaseout

comment.narrative: Phaseout included in adopted RK law On Energy Efficiency but without specific implementation plans
Phaseout implemented in stages and documented 100W bulbs phased out by 2013 75W bulbs by 2014 and 25W bulbs by 2015

By the Energy saving and energy efficiency Law dated January 13 2012 the incandescent lamps are subject for a gradual withdrawal
The Law includes a few phases of realization
The first phase since July 1 2012 100 Wt and higher incandescent lamps are to be withdrawn from the import and production
The second phase этап since January 1 2013 75Wt and higher
The third phase since January 1 2014 года 25 Wt and higher

description.narrative: Procurement of energyefficient lighting by public agencies

comment.narrative: Public agencies do not consider lifecycle costs or energy efficiency of lighting equipment in procurement
Observance of recommended procurement guidelines by at least two national agencies or other bulk purchasers
In accordance with the order 415 dated March 31 2015 the state purchases shall be performed in accordance with the new approved requirements to lighting fixtures for indoor and outdoor lighting

description.narrative: To phase out inefficient lighting and transform lighting markets towards greater energy efficiency while ensuring product quality and costeffectiveness as well as safe disposition of spent mercurycontaining lamps
Electricity consumption and associated GHG emissions from lighting

comment.narrative: 100 TWhyear and 93 million tons of CO2year
7 TWhyear and 65 million tonnes of CO2year
76 TWhyear and 74 million tonnes of CO2year

description.narrative: Adoption of IL phaseout and associated policies

comment.narrative: IL phaseout adopted but without specific implementation plans
IL phaseout and full range of accompanying policies implemented including technical standards

By the Energy saving and energy efficiency Law dated January 13 2012 the incandescent lamps are subject for a gradual withdrawal
The Law includes a few phases of realization
The first phase since July 1 2012 100 Wt and higher incandescent lamps are to be withdrawn from the import and production
The second phase этап since January 1 2013 75Wt and higher
The third phase since January 1 2014 года 25 Wt and higher

description.narrative: Mobilization of investment and other financial support for EE lighting in Kazakhstan

comment.narrative: Investment and state budget support for EE lighting is just beginning in Kazakhstan
US 28 million in cofinancing for EE lighting secured and applied
11 mln US dollars were spent from the local budgets for the EE lighting for the period of 2014

description.narrative: Quantity of contained and uncontained mercury from lamps relative to the overall quantity of Hgcontaining lamps in the market This indicator depends directly on Hg content of lamps their operating lifetime and effectiveness of collection and containment

comment.narrative:
No limit on quantity of mercury in CFLs
No requirement or standards for operating life time of CFLs
Containment not defined quantitatively collection and recycling only from state agencies and larger enterprises not general public
At least three regional programs for collection and containment of spent fluorescent lamps with documented 50 percent recovery of mercury from spent lamps

The number of the collected and utilized lamps is 657 mln lamps 247 mln for the reported period
In Astana the utilization of mercury lamps from local population continues 1200 thous lamps have been collected

description.narrative: Share of incandescent lamps CFLs and other types of conventional and efficient lighting

comment.narrative: Share of IL lighting accounts for 77 percent of total lighting in buildings Lamps up to 100W are permitted to use till July 2012

Incandescent lighting is no longer sold for conventional applications in Kazakhstan In addition to mediumterm targets the documented enlargement of LED share on market is 6 from the total lighting in the country

Incandescent lamps cover 32 of all lighting in buildings
Incandescent lamps are banned for sale in Kazakhstan
